item.title: üí° The "just ask" principle
item.description: A foundational principle of open memetics is: just ask for people‚Äôs data. People will happily give you their data if they understand why you want it, and feel like it will be good for them.

item.title: Psyop vs Vibe
item.description: In the network of people who uploaded to the Twitter Community Archive , the word ‚Äúpsyop‚Äù entered suddenly, and remained in the lexicon ever since. Compared to the word ‚Äúvibe‚Äù, which has a more organic pattern.

item.title: World Discourse
item.description: Prompt Provide me a digest of world news in the last 24 hours. Answer Here is a digest of world news from the last 24 hours, based on available information from recent web sources.

item.title: Memetics Discourse
item.description: Prompt Provide me a digest of the discourse in the last 24 hours about memetics, memetic warfare, propaganda, etc. Especially anything about ‚Äòmetamemes‚Äô (these are memes that affect the host‚Äôs epistemology, and therefore change the substrate of how all memes spread) Answer Based on the available information from online discussions, particularly posts found on social media platforms like X, there has been limited but notable discourse in the last 24 hours (as of the most recent data available up to May 20, 2025) regarding memetics, memetic warfare, propaganda, and related concepts.
Attention devs: the xAI API just got A LOT smarter. With Live Search, Grok can now search through realtime data from ùïè, the internet, trending news, and more.
